text: Hey guys. Who can I speak to right now for a rough estimate on some HubSpot COS work?
I would ask in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> and include a description of the CMS Hub work you’re looking to have done.

Hey Guys - any thoughts on this? I think Steven is correct to think that it has to do with where the editor styles are loaded. Id be happy to hop on a call with someone too if this needs some further explanation.

No further explanation needed at this time. We’re looking into it. Because moving the style tag that is generated could have harmful effects to live websites I can’t promise a timeframe on a resolution.
Thats what I had assumed. Appreciate the update, <@U7SL518D6>!

Hi Community,

I was looking on mobile from the preview in HubSpot and also from an Iphone. How can I centre the text where it says "get started" an make it look better that is on the page here? <https://www.incoognito.com/home>

<@U7SL518D6> Can I actually propose a temporary fix? I was able to add
```div[class*="force-full-width-section"] > .row-fluid {
         max-width: none !important;
      }```
to the head which seems to fix the issue with the horizontal constraint.

Is there a way that a class can be added only if these sections have no padding/no margin? a generic like hs-0-padding hs-0-margin?

I can just do the same thing in the head then and target that class. Currently padding and margins are added to a row specific class.

It’s a bit of a workaround at this point but its def a help.

Appreciate the suggestion. A more permanent fix is in progress.

Do you foresee a use for said generic classes beyond solving for this issue?
No I think I was just going to say that might be a solution that could be rolled out a bit faster if the more permanent fix was going to be on the backburner for some time.

Hey everyone. Thanks for keeping this Slack community open. I'm new to this, as my boss desperately needs another developer that works with HS. I can learn by myself but I need some guidance. Where do I start? Does anybody have 50 cents on that?
Welcome! The CMS for developers certification is a good place to start - <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>

Hey there <@U014D3L4K6X> the best place to start is <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started>

After that I encourage you to review the <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/key-concepts|key concepts page> to get a good overview of CMS Hub.
Awesome! thank you guys so much!
It can be effected depending on the page but here’s an article describing how to fix it <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/form-in-the-wrong-place-on-external-page>
Exactly what I needed! Thank you!
Thanks Jon, sorry for posting it in general.
Its okay just wanted to make sure those looking to do some work see your post.
Where are you putting it?
In the cupboard?
